---
  description: Setting limits on the coordinate system to zoom the plot and then convert them with ggplotly.
  function: coord_cartesian
  permalink: /ggplot2/Coordinate systems/coord_cartesian/
  layout: base
  language: ggplot2
  name: coord_cartesian
  reference: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/
---



# Default scatter plot

There are two ways of zooming the plot display: with scales or with coordinate systems. They work in two rather different ways.



<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(disp, wt)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth()
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Zoom using scale

Setting the limits on a scale converts all values outside the range to NA.


<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(disp, wt)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth()
  
p <-  p + scale_x_continuous(limits = c(325, 500))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Zoom using coordinate system

Setting the limits on the coordinate system performs a visual zoom.

The data is unchanged, and we just view a small portion of the original plot. Note how smooth continues past the points visible on this plot.


<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(disp, wt)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth()

p <-  p + coord_cartesian(xlim = c(325, 500))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

By default, the same expansion factor is applied as when setting scale limits. You can set the limits precisely by setting expand = FALSE


<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(disp, wt)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth()

p <-  p + coord_cartesian(xlim = c(325, 500), expand = FALSE)

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

Simiarly, you can use expand = FALSE to turn off expansion with the default limits.



<pre class="mcode">
p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(disp, wt)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth()

p <-  p + coord_cartesian(expand = FALSE)

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

d <- ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price)) +
  stat_bin2d(bins = 25, colour = "white")

p <-  d + scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, 1))

# Zoom using coordinate system


<pre class="mcode">
d <- ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price)) +
  stat_bin2d(bins = 25, colour = "white")

p <-  d + coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 1))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>
